etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin contradictio(n-), from the verb contradicere (see contradict)

definitions: a combination of statements, ideas, or features of a situation that are opposed to one another

examples.text: the proposed new system suffers from a set of internal contradictions

shortDefinitions: combination of statements, ideas, or features

definitions: a person, thing, or situation in which inconsistent elements are present

examples.text: the paradox of using force to overcome force is a real contradiction

shortDefinitions: situation in which inconsistent elements are present

definitions: the statement of a position opposite to one already made

examples.text: the second sentence appears to be in flat contradiction of the first
the experiment provides a contradiction of the hypothesis

shortDefinitions: statement of position opposite to one already made
